title: How to prove by induction, if a $\in$ n and n$\in \omega$ then a$\in \omega$ (set theory, advice, math) - Quora

response.answer_text: Please learn to use TeX correctly. For example `a $\in$ n’ should be typeset as `$a\in \mathbb{N}$ to get a∈Na∈N. What is `\omega’? Should it be ΩΩ? If so what do you mean by that as it is not standard notation.
